metadata.synopsis: Daisy Dream for Act 3: No longer needing to manipulate the player, Daisy is ready to reveal all in this steamy conclusion to a relationship born out of necessity and lies that blossomed into something even more fucked up. Content warning: Nudity, Tentacles, Transracialism, Hallucinations.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Queue Campnight NIGHT_DaisyAcknowledgementEnd the Day and Go to Bed

147.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
147.text: They say that home is where a person can be their truest selves, without guile, without pretence.
147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player wakes up in the dream field. Night. The Emperor is sitting next to them, staring into the sky.

30.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
30.text: You did well to see off the githyanki who had invaded mine.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor turns to face us, player sits up.

143.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
143.text: And now that you have seen where I come from, you know all there is to know about me. At least all that matters.

38.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
38.text: The flavours of my favourite fiddlehead soup, should you wish to experience it for yourself.

18.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
18.text: My beloved confidant and loyal companion, Rascal.

82.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
82.text: The very first reward I gifted myself on completion of my first adventure.

41.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
41.text: The garments with which I concealed and later constructed my appearance as the Emperor.

67.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
67.text: We spoke of my relationship with Duke Belynne Stelmane - a story I have told no one else.

167.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
167.text: I have no more secrets from you. No need to resort to subterfuge. We are true allies now, working towards a common goal.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: You really don't sound like a mind flayer.

215.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
215.text: I have learned to adapt my methods to your needs.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: You led an exciting life. Why did you conceal it from me?

134.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
134.text: By necessity, not design. But I am glad you appreciate the richness of my experience.

36.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
36.text: Yours has been no less exciting. But even with all your experience, it has not been easy.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Why did you resort to subterfuge at all?

198.speaker: Player
198.text: You did some pretty bad things. I'm not sure how I feel about being your ally.

9.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
9.text: You wouldn't even have come this far without me so, as I see it, you don't have a choice.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: You do a great impression of a human. But you're not fooling me.

193.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
193.text: Your distrust of me will be our undoing. Would it make a difference if I let you read my thoughts?

160.speaker: Player
160.text: You're an expert at mental manipulation. I wouldn't trust anything you show me.

34.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
34.text: I will take that as a yes.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: It's fine. I just wanted you to know I know your true nature.

87.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
87.text: You think you know my true nature?

186.speaker: Player
186.text: Please don't show me your thoughts - I've been there and I didn't like it.

172.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
172.text: Good. Then you understand why I had to do what I did. It was for your own good.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: No need. You're right. We need to trust each other.

142.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
142.text: I trust you. And I did what I needed to earn your trust too.

218.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
218.text: The only way we were ever going to get close enough to the brain to destroy it was by working together.

203.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
203.text: But few would trust a mind flayer, so I did what I had to do to convince you.

122.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
122.text: I studied you. Your motivations, your actions, your desires. I deduced the best way to align your goals with my own.

223.speaker: Player
223.text: You make it sound like I was some sort of experiment.

146.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
146.text: Perhaps, at first, I did consider that you were just a problem to be solved. And not an easy one at that. But I persisted.

61.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
61.text: That you are complex. And full of contradictions. It was no easy task, but I had to persist.

40.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
40.text: I needed your absolute dedication to the cause.

6.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
6.text: I anticipated the challenge, and I anticipated your resistance.

91.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
91.text: What I didn't anticipate was how exhausting you would be.

20.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
20.text: You were stubborn, antagonistic. You didn't want to listen.

11.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
11.text: You even tried to kill me.

112.speaker: Player
112.text: You weren't that easy to work with either.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I refuse to be controlled by anyone but my own self.

94.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
94.text: And yet, here you are, exactly as I instructed. That is all I needed.

213.speaker: Player
213.text: Let me get this straight. You're complaining about being stuck with me?

37.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
37.text: But you made your choices - such is the burden of freedom. And now we must move on.

144.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor stands up. Player stands up.

25.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
25.text: What I didn't anticipate was how reasonable you would be.

155.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
155.text: You don't like to be coddled, cajoled. But you responded well to logic, to rational arguments, to cold, hard facts.

127.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
127.text: You saw straight to the core of what really mattered.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I could have done with a little more coddling.

187.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
187.text: I didn't get that impression. And my calculations are never wrong.

1.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
1.text: What I didn't anticipate was how much I would enjoy your company. Your mind.

150.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
150.text: Sometimes I felt almost like we were dancing our way towards something deeper...

165.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
165.text: You know... this might be our last chance to explore the possibility of... a deeper relationship.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: You're trying to flirt with me now?

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *The back of your mind warms with a rush of feeling, the Emperor's feeling - heat, care, arousal.*

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *And in this dream world, the fires that burn inside you wouldn't  hurt a fly, much less a mind flayer.*

133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor levitates player and himself into the air with psionic abilities.

148.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor leans in towards the player.

184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player leans in towards Emperor's face, as you would to lean in for a kiss.

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *You feel its breath merging into yours, cold, smelling faintly of vanilla and garlic.*

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *Its breathing quickens as you pull in close to its face. Its excitement palpable.*

212.speaker: Narrator
212.text: *You pause a moment as a thought occurs to you - where is a mind flayer's mouth?*

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Take its tentacle in your hand, invite it in.

32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out and takes the Emperor's tentacle in their hand (equivalent of holding hands). Player leans in towards Emperor, as if for a kiss.

162.speaker: Narrator
162.text: *Its breathing quickens as you pull in close to its face. Its excitement palpable.*

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *A memory stirs - diagrams in a book you read long ago - a mind flayer's mouth is underneath the tentacles.*

135.speaker: Narrator
135.text: *A memory stirs - diagrams in a book you read long ago - a mind flayer's mouth is underneath the tentacles.*

191.speaker: Narrator
191.text: *If this creature is at all similar to an octopus, as it appears to be, its mouth is probably somewhere underneath the tentacles.*

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *If this creature is at all similar to an octopus, as it appears to be, its mouth is probably somewhere underneath the tentacles.*

173.speaker: Player
173.text: Kiss the tentacle and hope that it's an erogenous appendage.

4.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kisses the tip of the tentacle. The mind flayer closes its eyes and emits a sound. NodeContext: Ambiguous - did he enjoy that or no? (The truth is he did.)

159.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor nods, its eyes still closed.

80.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player kisses the tentacle again. Mind flayer lets out a moan. NodeContext: Erotic, but in a guttural alien way

174.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot over Emperor's shoulder of a tentacle gently wrapping around the player's head, and pulling the player in for a kiss. Player is pulled out of shot (implying both mind flayer and player are now lying down having sex.) Fade to black. One last shudder of a tentacle in the air on the way out.

211.speaker: Narrator
211.text: *Everything you ever dreamt of and more. The single greatest experience of your life.*
211.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade in: Player and mind flayer lying down side by side, looking up at the stars, a hint of naked torso visible where the sheet ends.

141.speaker: Narrator
141.text: *Pleasure upon pleasure as mind and body intertwined. It was hard to tell where thoughts ended and feelings began.*
141.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player rolls onto their side to look at the Emperor.

207.speaker: Narrator
207.text: *You can read the Emperor's expression better now that you've connected on a deeper level. You know it feels the same way.*
207.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor rolls into its side to look adoringly at the player (or as close as a mind flayer can get.)

181.speaker: Player
181.text: I'm sorry. I just don't know what I'm doing.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Could you maybe not make that noise?

221.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
221.text: I'm sorry - it's a reflex. But I can stop if I do this...

185.speaker: Player
185.text: Perhaps now just isn't the time. That was... awkward.

219.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
219.text: I understand. Then let us move on to other things.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Would you mind parting those tentacles?

158.speaker: Player
158.text: This is awkward... I want to kiss you but I have no idea where.

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *You can't tell if the mind flayer is smiling or not. A symptom of your wider problem.*

117.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
117.text: I can make this easier for you if you like. My other form might be more familiar for you to navigate.

217.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind flayer transforms back into Daisy form.

7.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Shot over Daisy pulling the player in for a kiss. Player is pulled out of shot (implying both Daisy and player are now lying down having sex.) Fade to black. 

This will have to account for different player sizes and different daisy sizes.

35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player rolls over onto their side and clocks the mind flayer lying next to them with mild horror.

84.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
84.text: Sorry. You didn't leave me much energy to spare to maintain appearances.
84.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor rolls into its side to look at the player - acknowledges our skeptical look. NodeContext: sheepish, a bit cheeky

83.context: CinematicNodeContext: They sit up and see a portal has been open the entire time.

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *It seems the tadpole allowed you to share more than you would have liked with your companions.*
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Through it, their companions stand in a row, aghast. They witnessed it all. The player nudges the Emperor off-screen. The Emperor wakes up and sits up. The player looks at the Emperor with a look of 'what on earth is going on?!'

114.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
114.text: I said I'd protect you from the Absolute, not each other. And I was... distracted.
114.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Emperor sits up, waves its hand, and the portal closes. NodeContext: matter of fact

93.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
93.text: Don't worry. I'll make sure they don't remember a thing.
93.context: NodeContext: referencing the fact that the player just saw all their companions looking at them in a post-coital state with the Emperor - delivered in a matter-of-fact way (he's going to wipe their memories)

136.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
136.text: Come - it is time to get dressed. We have work to do.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: You sure I can't tempt you into another round?

169.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
169.text: I am tempted. But it will be quite some time before I am - ah - able - to do that again. And time is not on our side.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Are we not going to talk about what just happened?

164.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
164.text: We have communed with our minds entire at the deepest level. What else is there to say?

110.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
110.text: We are bonded now. And it is time to consummate love, with war.

195.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gets up and gets dressed.

106.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
106.text: The elder brain's hivemind has grown to monstrous proportions. And through the Crown's magic, it has complete control over each and every member.

3.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
3.text: It was intelligent before. But now, with its hivemind established across the city, it is well on its way to becoming indestructible.

111.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
111.text: You know now of your Father's plans to use the elder brain to slaughter the world over. One need not read minds to foresee the horrors he will pen with your hand if you do not stand against him.

220.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
220.text: You should reconsider your attachment to your physical form. You have seen what an illithid can do.

48.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
48.text: Imagine - some of that could be in your grasp. Not enough to warp your appearance beyond recognition, but just enough to enhance your potential.

130.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
130.text: And believe me, it will radically increase our chances of success against the elder brain.

75.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black implying player falling asleep.

88.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black implying player falling asleep.

39.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
39.text: You should reconsider your attachment to your physical form. You have seen what an illithid can do. You have experienced the pleasure for yourself.

171.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
171.text: It would make us even more compatible.

138.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
138.text: As well as radically increasing our chances of success against the elder brain.

216.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
216.text: We must stop it while we still can. Before we, too, become its slaves.
216.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black implying player falling asleep.

132.speaker: Narrator
132.text: *As you drift into sleep, you feel a certain disappointment. The mind flayer was very quick to abandon its attentions on you.*
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black implying player falling asleep.

8.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
8.text: We must stop it while we still can. Before we, too, become its slaves.
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fade to black implying player falling asleep.

175.speaker: Player
175.text: I prefer this one. Just... show me what to do.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Try to find its mouth so you can kiss it.

113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts their hand and reaches out to part the mind flayer's tentacles. The mind flayer raises its own hand to stop you.

157.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
157.text: I'm sorry - you're right - now's not the time. Forget I said anything.

77.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
77.text: Let's move on to more important things.

2.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
2.text: Is it? We have experienced much together. Consider this an opportunity for further mutual exploration.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I'd rather we stick to business.

205.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
205.text: Freak? If only you knew... but why conceal it? You may as well see for yourself.
205.context: CinematicNodeContext: snap his hand to cast the vision

65.context:
CinematicNodeContext: We see Stelmane lying in a coma in her bed. Shot of her eyes moving left and right under the lids, a struggle painted all over her face. 

Background becomes black - we see the Emperor standing over her bed in the same scene, dominating her mind with psychic energy. 

Shot of Stelmane's eyes blinking open, possessed.

176.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Moving still: Stelmane and a merchant in conversation. Through a gap in the door behind them, the mind flayer’s eyes glow. Shot of merchan'ts unease. Shot of Stelmane's face - eyes rolled back like Orpheus', clearly possessed. 

NB this is the same as the scene in INT_EmperorRevealed_AfterOrpheus but with the added reveal of Stelmane's possession.

44.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Moving still: Stelmane and Emperor toasting one another in her office. 

The Emperor pulls out the chair for her. She sits. Shot of her in her big chair with her eyes rolled to the whites, completely posssessed. 

NB this is the same as the scene in INT_EmperorRevealed_AfterOrpheus but with the added reveal of Stelmane's possession.

10.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
10.text: Did you like it - the truth? This was the alternative relationship we could have had. Aren't you glad I finessed my methods?

95.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
95.text: But since you insist on thwarting my craft, let us be blunt.

92.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
92.text: You are my puppet. Make no mistake. Without me, you have no value.

31.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
31.text: You will take me to the brain because you have no other choice. And once we are there, you will do exactly what I tell you to.

14.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
14.text: And you would do well to reconsider unlocking your potential. Your puerile attachment to your material form jeopardises us all. If I must, I will force you.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: You're right. For now, we have to be allies.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: Finally the mask drops. And you put so much effort into it.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: First chance I get I will rip your head off, mind flayer.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: I should have thrown you and the Prism to the shadow curse.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: I think you misread the signs - I'm fine with what we have now.

81.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
81.text: I'm sorry - you're right - now's not the time. Forget I said anything.

86.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
86.text: Let's move on to more important things.

199.speaker: Player
199.text: You could have been open with me from the start.

225.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
225.text: Perhaps, but I couldn't take the risk. An elder brain leaves no room for error.

71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Emperor turns to face us, player sits up.
